intro: Senecio chiribogae, commonly known as the Andean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a rough texture, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Senecio chiribogae is considered a rare and endemic species.
